content.body: Yeah the constructors are almost like an implementation detail, the static methods are the real API
content.formatted_body: Yeah the constructors are almost like an implementation detail, the static methods are the real API

content.body:
From the Temporal docs:

> Like all Temporal constructors, this constructor is an advanced API used to create instances for a narrow set of use cases.
content.formatted_body:
From the Temporal docs:

 

> Like all Temporal constructors, this constructor is an advanced API used to create instances for a narrow set of use cases.

content.body: I never thought to object to that but like
is the argument that you wouldn't need to create an object as a prerequisite for instantiating a Temporal class?
I can see the advantage of keeping the actual constructors as simple as possible yeah. no object allocation, no chance of getters
content.formatted_body: I can see the advantage of keeping the actual constructors as simple as possible yeah. no object allocation, no chance of getters
